methods.name: Row
methods.description: Create a Row object to interact with your table rows.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Create a new row in your table.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: createRules
methods.description: Update a row with rules specifying how the row's contents are to be transformed into writes. Rules are applied in order, meaning that earlier rules will affect the results of later ones.

examples.caption: Add an increment amount to an existing value, if the targeted cell is unset, it will be treated as containing a zero.
You can also create a rule that will append data to an existing value. If the targeted cell is unset, it will be treated as a containing an empty string.

params.name: rules
params.description: • The rules to apply to this row.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: filter
methods.description: Mutates a row atomically based on the output of a filter. Depending on whether or not any results are yielded, either the onMatch or onNoMatch callback will be executed.

examples.caption: Optionally, you can pass in an array of entries to be ran in the event that a match is not made.

params.name: filter
params.description: • Filter ot be applied to the contents of the row.

params.name: onMatch
params.description: • A list of entries to be ran if a match is found.

params.name: onNoMatch
params.description: • A list of entries to be ran if no matches are found.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.matched
params.description: • Whether a match was found or not.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: deleteCells
methods.description: Delete specified cells from the row. See bigtable/table#mutate.

examples.caption: Delete individual cells.

params.name: columns
params.description: • Column names for the cells to be deleted.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

examples.caption: Use this method to grab an entire row
Or pass in an array of column names to populate specific cells. Under the hood this will create an interleave filter.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: increment
methods.description: Increment a specific column within the row. If the column does not exist, it is automatically initialized to 0 before being incremented.

examples.caption: Specify a custom amount to increment the column by.
To decrement a column, simply supply a negative value.

params.name: column
params.description: • The column we are incrementing a value in.

params.name: value
params.description: • The amount to increment by, defaults to 1.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

examples.caption: Update a single cell.

params.name: key
params.description: • Either a column name or an entry object to be inserted into the row. See bigtable/table#insert.

params.name: value
params.description: • This can be omitted if using entry object.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.
